Y. and Chi. and prin­ cipal cities. See Adv. Page VI. BUFFALO ' How to Analyze Real Estate Bonds 3. Moderate-Sized Loans: Our policy is to finance numerous properties of moderate size, easily managed, readily saleable and widely scattered. A real form of diversifica­ tion. 4. Full Interest: Every Miller Bond pays the full prevailing rate of interest, depend­ ing on the location of security. We deduct nothing. Bankers have thought it difficult to analyze the security of First Mortgage Real Estate Bonds, whether as collateral or in giving investment ad­ vice. Here are the Four Distinguishing Marks of Miller First Mortgage Bonds, which make analysis easy: y X l. Independent Appraisals: Local author­ ities, in signed appraisals, give their esti­ mates of physical value and earnings of the mortgaged property. The reputation of the issuing house, plus these four positive checks, provide a genuine basis for comparing Miller Bonds with any other securities. Send for descriptive circulars of new issues. 2. Bank Certification: A local bank places its certificate of genuineness on each bond. G. L. MILLER & CO. It is the constant endeavor of this institution to grasp and act upon the viewpoint of its clients.
